alert.note: Alert for Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 10:40PM EST until December 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Spartanburg. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1037 PM EST, Automated rain gauges continue to indicate elevated stream levels across most of central and northern Spartanburg County due to runoff from earlier heavy rainfall. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area and will continue into the early overnight hours. - Some locations that will experience minor flooding include... Spartanburg, Greer, Boiling Springs SC, Duncan, Lyman, Pacolet, Landrum, Cowpens, Wellford, Inman, Mayo, Roebuck, Chesnee, Pacolet Mills, Campobello, Reidville, USC Upstate, Moore, Cedar Springs and the Lake Bowen vicinity. - Flooding is most likely along Lawsons Fork Creek on the east side of Spartanburg and along the Pacolet River near Campobello and in downstream areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
